div.p: Gothenburg Public School has an opening for a special education paraprofessional for the 2020-2021 school year. Interested individuals contact, Lori Verster at the district office to have an application mailed to you. Questions may be directed to Teresa Schneider, director of special education at (308) 537-3651 ext 2242.

Gothenburg Public Schools is currently seeking applicants for a full-time Custodian. Compensation includes a competitive salary, health insurance and retirement benefits. Position to begin May 15th. Contact the District Office at (308) 537-3651, Ext. 4103, for application materials or visit www.gothenburgswedes.org/district/job-openings.

Gothenburg Public Schools is currently seeking applicants for a Food Handler. This position would start in the fall when school resumes. Interested individuals may pick up an application in the district office. Questions for the Food Handler position please contact Joni at 308-537-3651 ext. 6127.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: The NDE (Nebraska Department of Education) is advising that summer activities involving school students be put on hold due to the pandemic. That being said… the Elementary 2020 Summer Art Camp will need to be canceled. As this breaks my heart to cancel a week full of fun activities, I truly want to keep all students and families safe during this time. Refunds will be issued to those that have already paid for camp. Those checks will be refunded in the coming weeks. If you have any questions, please reach out to Mrs. Stortenbecker via email.
Continue creating! Stay safe & healthy!
Mrs. Stortenbecker

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-3 term-elementary term-2 term-high-school term-6 term-news clearfix

h2.a: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

span.content: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

h2.a: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

div.p: Update 4/27/20 - Good Evening, this is Dr. Rhodes Gothenburg Schools Superintendent. First and foremost, we hope that this message finds you are safe and healthy. After surveying the Class of 2020 we have set the date of Saturday, August 1st at 7:00 p.m. for this year’s commencement exercises. The type of graduation will be dependent on the recommendations and guidance set forth by the State of Nebraska and the Local Health Department. Prom which had been postponed has now been canceled. The school district is currently evaluating and working on a plan for summer school. We are trying to create multiple options at this time. The option we choose will be based on health guidance at that time. To help collect all library materials that are still checked out, we are offering several book drop-off opportunities. Mrs. Long will collect all Junior High and High School library materials on Thursday, April 30th and Friday, May 1st from 1:00 - 3:30 p.m. in the southwest corner of the high school parking lot. Mrs. Harrison will collect all elementary library materials on Thursday, April 30th from 7:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. at the elementary front doors. As a reminder May 6th is the last day for Seniors and May 15th is the last day for all K-11th grade students. On behalf of the Faculty and Staff of Gothenburg Public Schools we miss you and look forward to the time we are all back together again. Thank you and good evening.
Update 4/23/20 - Click here to view the Gothenburg Virtual Town Hall Meeting on 4/23/20.
Click here for previous information released by the school & community on the COVID-19.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Graduation commencement has been scheduled for Saturday, August 1st at 7:00 pm. The type of commencement exercises will be commensurate to the guidelines set forth by the State of Nebraska and Local Health Department.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: The following is the newly adopted Pass/No Harm grading policy for grades 9-12 to finish out the 2020 school year. Students that work to submit an assignment with some type of good faith effort will receive a mark that meets proficiency. If a final grade on the assignment would lower their percentage grade in the class, it will be marked as EXEMPT. If nothing is ever turned in, or it is not completed in good faith, the assignment score will be marked MISSING.

Students cannot receive a lower grade than their 3rd quarter grade in PowerSchool. When students turn in assignments and those assignments are assessed and reviewed, student semester grades can only improve; their grade cannot go down. There are no penalties for late work. If a student is not turning in assignments, the first intervention should be to contact the student or family and find out why. It is the expectation of Gothenburg Public Schools that students put forth good faith effort to complete coursework in order to receive course credit.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Sports physicals on file for the 2019-2020 school year for any current 9-11 grade students will now also be valid for the 2020-2021 school year. All incoming freshmen (Current 8th graders) will still be required to provide sports physical paperwork that is dated no earlier than May 1, 2020.

The physicals that the current 7th graders have on file for the 2019-2020 school year can be used for NSAA/athletic purposes for the 2020-2021 school year. All incoming 7th graders (Current 6th graders) will need a physical for NSAA/athletic purposes.
If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Marc Mroczek, Gothenburg Public Schools Activities Director, at marc.mroczek@goswedes.org.

node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

h3.strong: The Gothenburg FFA Greenhouse Will Officially Open On April 18th!

div.p: Hours: Mon-Fri 4:30 pm - 6:30 pm Sat. 9:00 am -12:00 noon Sun 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm
Call 308-537-3651 ext. 3110 for greenhouse tour times every 15 minutes any days that we are open by appointment only - NO WALK-INS!
Curbside pickups and deliveries available. We will follow all CDC codes for the safety of our customers.
We will offer Venmo and will hope to have a credit card reader for payments. We will also have prices set up with tax included, this will avoid counting back change.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-2 term-high-school term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: The 2019-2020 yearbooks are on sale now. You can purchase your yearbook online by clicking on the picture below or stop by Mrs. Keiser's room and order yours today!

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Any students that need to drive with Mr. Reeves will be contacted by May 1st. Drive times will be set up depending on the COVID 19 situation in Nebraska.
You will drive when the State of Nebraska and Gothenburg Public Schools allows. If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Reeves at steve.reeves@goswedes.org.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Swede Pride, Swede Strong, and Swede Nation has never meant more than it does during this time that we are away from our Swede Family! There is nothing greater that we can give to each other than the gift of time, encouragement, and support. As we face this COVID-19 pandemic, current challenges, and challenges that are yet to come, please remember to continue to support your friends, family, and neighbors with ACT!

p.strong: A – Acknowledge. Acknowledge their concern, worries, fears, frustration, or sadness.
C – Care. Show that you care by offering support through listening and encouragement.
T – Tell. Tell a trusted adult that you have a concern so that an adult can check in with them.

div.p: Parents or students are encouraged to call or reach out to school counselors, teachers, or administrators if you need support or if you know of someone who needs additional support.
Jerry Wiggins (ext. 4124) jerry.wiggins@goswedes.org
Pam Glodowski (ext. 3134) pam.glodowski@goswedes.org
Michelle Stevens (ext. 2202) michelle.stevens@goswedes.org
Melissa Shepherd (ext. 2248) melissa.shepherd@goswedes.org

p.strong: Immediate Emergency or Immediate Safety Concern Call:

div.p: Emergency: 911
Gothenburg Police Department: 308-537-3608
Dawson County Sheriff: 308-324-3011
Nebraska Family Helpline: 1-888-866-8660

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

Click here to find out information on the K-3 Spring Program. Questions, please contact Mrs. Shepherd at melissa.shepherd@goswedes.org.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-3 term-elementary term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Kindergarten Registration for the 2020-2021 school year will look a little bit different this year due to the COVID-19 school closure. Here are three links that will help with the Kindergarten Registration process.

Kindergarten Registration Presentation:
https://drive.google.com/…/1pcK-o_etM5NVPH1DZZ2nE7kdr…/view…

Kindergarten Packet:
https://drive.google.com/…/1CAjqfO7wu1vPazpfOhioG5712…/view…

Kindergarten Official Registration:
https://forms.gle/g66Daimx9hR8NSaD8
If you have questions, please contact Angie Richeson (Elementary Principal) at angie.richeson@goswedes.org or Melissa Haas (School Nurse) at melissa.haas@goswedes.org
